item.title: Craig Allen is getting traction on election promises by building diversity and inclusion, improving documentation, and building connections in Africa--read the rest of his statement here: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Craig Allen (South Africa) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/cRaIgalLAn üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616766701202284547

a new blog post is up! "Starting 2023 on the OSMF Board" The OSMF board met and set an agenda for next year--here is a top level overview in their own words. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/

https://twitter.com/OSM_Tech/status/1614785339729625090 RT @OSM_Tech@twitter.com Reminder of upcoming scheduled maintenance this Sunday January 22nd 2023 between 10:00 and 15:00 UTC/GMT. Full details: https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2022-December/087948.html ü™õüíæüíªüòÖ üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/OSM_Tech/status/1614785339729625090

Read about these folks' many contributions to OSM communities and working groups, organizations like @GeochicasOSM@twitter.com @WomenInGeo@twitter.com, @StreetComplete@twitter.com, @hotosm@twitter.com & many other projects & find links to interviews at the link: #osmf #OpenStreetMap https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/19/get-to-know-the-new-osmf-board/
Sarah Hoffmann (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Lonvia
Roland Olbricht (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Roland.olbricht
Mikel Maron (USA) @mikel@twitter.com
Mateusz Konieczny (Poland) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Mateusz%20Konieczny
Guillaume Rischard (Luxembourg) @grischard@twitter.com
Craig Allen (South Africa) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/cRaIgalLAn
Here's the Twitter version: (in alphabetical order on the post and here) Arnalie Vicario (Philippines) @arnalielsewhere@twitter.com
Meet your new OSMF board on the OSMF blog: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/19/get-to-know-the-new-osmf-board/
Today we have more than 10 million registered users! Why not join us? Sign up to contribute to the map near you! Graph of registered user count this week. Surpassing 10,000,000 today!
Don't forget to make time for the OSM data model conversation this weekend! https://blog.openstreetmap.org/?p=176655718 a meme that is a "to do" list for sharing thoughts about the OSM data model
Feel strongly about the OSM data model? Read and contribute to the OSM community discussion here: https://github.com/osmlab/osm-data-model/discussions/9

Call for feedback! The Engineering Working Group needs your feedback on the proposal to change the data model: You can read the latest update on http://OSM.org from Jochen Topf https://blog.openstreetmap.org/?p=176655718

The blog post about the new communities tab on http://OSM.org is in many respects a story about volunteering for OSM. Check it out--and then maybe head on over to this link and review some pull requests! https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/issues/3815

And what is the new #OSM "Communities page" you might ask? Read all about it at the link. (With thanks to @joostjakob@twitter.com @gravitystorm@twitter.com and Adam Hoyle) https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/30/introducing-the-communities-tab-on-osm-org/
And here's #3 - the new "Communities" page on http://OSM.org https://community.openstreetmap.org/
Here's #2 - the OSM Discourse Community: https://community.openstreetmap.org/
